frontmatter.title: Understanding Rust Contextual Keywords
frontmatter.description: In this blog post, we explore the concept of Rust contextual keywords, which appear as regular identifiers until they are used in a specific context. We cover examples of contextual keywords such as 'self', 'Self', 'super', 'return', 'async', and 'await', showing how they operate differently depending on where they are used in a Rust program. By the end of this post, readers will have a better understanding of how to identify and use Rust contextual keywords in their own code.

frontmatter.title: Mastery in Rust: Understanding Ownership, Borrowing, and Lifetimes
